summary: This is an FBI Electronic Communication (FD-1057) summarizing a complaint letter from Daniel A. Ward, who claims to have filed a lawsuit against multiple entities and mentions Jeffrey Epstein and Jennifer Cipriana in the context of dismissed sexual assault cases. The document is a brief synopsis of the complaint.

persons.name: Daniel A Ward
persons.context: The individual who submitted the complaint letter, claiming false incarceration and that sexual assault cases are dismissed when the accused have money. He is incarcerated at S.O.C.F. Prison.

persons.name: Dennis Hartley
persons.context: Named as the attorney for Daniel A. Ward, with contact information provided in the complaint.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as one of the 'others' mentioned in the complaint letter in the context of sexual assault cases being dismissed.

persons.name: Jennifer Cipriana
persons.context: Named as one of the 'others' mentioned in the complaint letter alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Dennis Hartley is listed as the attorney for complainant Daniel A. Ward.
Both are mentioned in the same complaint letter regarding the dismissal of sexual assault cases.
Both are mentioned in the same complaint letter regarding the dismissal of sexual assault cases.

events.title: FBI Receipt of Complaint Letter
events.description: The FBI documents an electronic communication summarizing a complaint letter from Daniel A. Ward.

locations: S.O.C.F. Prison J4.58 MHC-1 PO BOX 45699 Luccusville Ohio 45699
keyFacts: Daniel A. Ward, a prisoner, filed a complaint alleging a lawsuit against the City of Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, the FBI, and the CIA.
The complaint claims sexual assault cases are dismissed when the accused have 'lots of money' and mentions Jeffrey Epstein and Jennifer Cipriana in this context.
The document is an FBI internal communication (FD-1057) summarizing the receipt of this complaint letter.
The complainant is incarcerated at S.O.C.F. Prison in Lucasville, Ohio.
